Author: Uha
Review Title: I totally understand that rates are…
Review Text: I totally understand that rates are fluctuating from time to time, what i like MG the most is that its fast and secure. How ever this is my very first time to have an account and is able to send money internationally. Apart from unstable internet connection i made so many attempts in creating my account due to errors. Finally im able to use it, what i fear is the fact that my family and friends back home where i send money to, have been once or twice blocked from receiving money on Money Gram without knowing why.  Therefore, i would like to know your reasons for those problems, as overcome by one of my friends, he was already sent money, but told by the teller that his named os blocked. The sender had to wait for a week or 2 until it got refunded to be send to another person. However the blocked person waited for 3 months until his name was unblocked due to the help of a BSP banker. please clarify on that.

Author: Paul Strong
Review Title: Never received money, moneygram refuses to help for 90 days.
Review Text: Never received money, MoneyGram is holding it for 90 days. I transferred 772 usd to myself in Mexico like I have done on many occasions before, except this time I never got the money. When I called customer service to complain they said that their records show that it was transferred and that there was nothing they could do for now. They said they would initiate an investigation but it could take up to 90 days to get any resolution. Even after talking to a supervisor explaining that we really needed the money they callously just said we'd have to wait 30-90 days.Turns out this has been a standing practice of theirs. Just checkout BBB reviews, don't trust the good rating on TrustPilot!

Author: Hoda Sarwat
Review Text: I've never experienced such incompetence and disregard for customer satisfaction until I dealt with MoneyGram. After a transaction went awry, I've spent countless hours on the phone, speaking to representatives like Kevin and Erica, only to be met with empty promises and excuses. Despite numerous calls to customer service, each time I was met with the same scripted response as if my concerns were never addressed. It's infuriating to be left in the dark, with no resolution in sight and no further information provided. MoneyGram's abysmal customer service has left me feeling utterly helpless and betrayed. Avoid at all costs unless you enjoy wasting your time and money on a company that couldn't care less about its customers.

Review Title: I sent two $100 MoneyGramMoneyGram is a rip offs to a person…
Review Text: I sent two $100 MoneyGrams to a person I've known for over 20 years in St. Petersburg Florida. Neither transaction was accepted but yet they still charged me the service fee and refunded me my money. Not that getting my money was easy because it was not. It took several different steps to accomplish getting my refund. I will never ever ever use MoneyGram again. You can use Walmart to Walmart for $3 and why would you bother with the BS that you have to go through to use MoneyGram. I've also had MoneyGram denied because it didn't exactly match my license. How many people know what other people's middle names are on their license. It's simply ridiculous and they are ripping off the public and I just won't stand for it.

Like I said before, MoneyGram you have surpassed your creation and throttling ahead keep up the good work.

Money Gram should not do business with people who do not know how to deal with customers.  Both Mr. Barret and his workers let me feel like I stole money they talked down to me shouted at me and let me feel like I should not be collecting my own money.  Plus they advertise that opening hours is at 9 am.  The cambio had customers standing outside for 30 minutes without explaining to us.  There need to be regulations about Jamaican business practices with moneygram. This was the most horrible experience  I had when collecting my own money.

Review Title: Speed of Delivery:** The speed of MoneyGram’s service was exceptional. The funds were available to my family within just a few hours after sending, much faster than I anticipated. This quick delivery
Review Text: **Review Title: Efficient and Fast Experience with MoneyGram**I began my experience with MoneyGram when I needed to urgently send money to my family abroad. I was amazed by the service's ease of use and incredible speed.**Ease of Use:**From the start, I found using MoneyGram’s website extremely user-friendly. The interface is clear and the instructions are simple, making the process of setting up a money transfer smooth even for those who are not very tech-savvy. Every step was detailed and transparent, from selecting the amount to choosing the delivery method.**Speed of Delivery:**The speed of MoneyGram’s service was exceptional. The funds were available to my family within just a few hours after sending, much faster than I anticipated. This quick delivery was crucial and it reassured me during a time-sensitive situation.**Overall Experience:**MoneyGram stands out for its straightforward, no-hassle approach to money transfers. The fees were reasonable, especially considering the speed and reliability of the service. The peace of mind knowing that my money reached its destination safely and swiftly was worth it.**Conclusion:**I would definitely use MoneyGram again and recommend it to anyone in need of a reliable and fast money transfer service. Whether for emergency funds or regular transactions, MoneyGram provides an excellent solution with user-friendly technology and quick service.By highlighting these points, this review provides insight into what makes MoneyGram a convenient choice for fast and easy money transfers.

Review Text: I dealt with your company at least 3 different times through the virtual assistant twice and also through clicking on the contact and talking back-and-forth with an employee. I explained in great detail twice. What was wrong and people acted like when they contact me back? That was the first time they talked to me. They didn't understand anything that was happening even though I kept explaining it to them. And then they said they would pass it on and forward it and it would get fixed.  To this date, nothing is fixed. I can't send money on the app now for 6 weeks to my Girlfriend. I tried to delete my profile. Because I noticed my name was written twice and my girlfriend's profile was up there 3 times but it wouldn't let me edit or change anything. I had to verify my email and you guys said you'll get 30 days to get back with me. I'm so tired of this. I'm switching back to Western Union. That's the only way I can send money to my girlfriend. Or by using the rematly money ground doesn't work anymore. And you guys don't seem to wanna straighten anything out with it.

Author: MackSix
Review Text: I am hearing disabled and have tinnitus. My mother has dimension and I had to obtain guardianship and conservator of her to manage her money and take care of her. I had send MoneyGram from our joint bank account. I went to Bank of America to set up a conservator bank account for her and against my will, they closed the joint bank account before a moneygram payment fully processed. So the bank account withdraw that funded the moneygram was rejected. I made the moneygram transaction from my personal account afterwards. Moneygram then closed my online moneygram account for disputing the transaction. I did not dispute it, when I notified the bank, they shut it down against my will. I had no control over it. Their lawyers shut it down and created a new conservator account and moved all the money into it from her account and our joint account. I explained this on chat to the moneygram representative and she did not care and did not want to remedy a situation that was beyond my control. I have been a moneygram member for many years. I will never use moneygram again. Moneygram is a horrible company and there is far better alternatives available. Update 04/22/2024: Moneygram is now spamming my email after they closed my account! Ugh!

Author: leaving a review
Review Title: Long delay for pickup, long delay for refund
Review Text: Although the money was supposed to be available straight away, the receiver had been told it would take 5 to 7 days.  He was going to try again, and if he got the same delay, then I was going to cancel.  A customer representative in a chat went ahead and cancelled my transaction without my go-ahead, after I asked for a phone number to be able to cancel if there was any trouble with the pick-up.  The representative cancelled the transaction, and there is a 10 day delay to get a refund.  The money was already taken out of my bank account, even though it hadn't been picked up. Do not use this company unless you are sure it is trouble free in your location. I will stick to Western Union.

Author: Martin
Review Title: Unresolved issue - customer service doesn't want to know
Review Text: I had an issue because the Moneygram Agent would not pay funds to my intended recipient (although he knows her personally) because her Ecowas ID card was out of date, but it appears that before checking her ID he had processed the transaction. When I contacted Moneygram with the details and asked for it to be refunded to my account Customer Service just sent me a meaningless email telling me they welcomed the opportunity to address my concerns, but not actually doing so. They did not answer my specific query but simply told me that the money was with the Agent (which I obviously already knew). I have replied specifically asking if they will refund me or not, and if not what happens next, as the recipient's new ID will probably not arrive for several weeks. Currently it seems that the money is in the pocket of their Agent in Brikama, and Moneygram appear to be ignoring my email and hoping I will go away. Customer Service just doesn't want to know.

Author: Never Again
Review Text: Cancelled my 2 transactions to a friend in Mexico for no reason. When I asked them, they first hung up on me. Then the next person told me it was "for security reasons" they could not tell me. Then his supervisor read the exact same script the 2nd guy used. When I filed a complaint with Moneygram corporate, I was told "Upon review, it appears that your concern about the transactions with the reference number of ****2942 and ****6382 that was canceled without an explanation has already been addressed by one of our representative." This level of incompetence is astounding. I can assure you I will never use Moneygram again.

Author: Wadilson  Ferreira
Review Text: "Dear Moneygram,I am emailing once again, with the utmost goodwill, to inform you that the receiver of the transaction made on the 8th of March 2024 hasn't received the amount sent till this day. I have called previously, and I have spoken to two members of your staff, that told me that I have made a mistake typing the Iban number of the account.The first member of staff asked me to repeat all the digits of the receiver account, subsequently telling me that they were wrong, therefore she would have to contact the person to which the funds were transferred to, to be able to retrieve the money and then transfer it to my Step fathers account.The first person I was able to speak to, told me then, that I had to wait for a minimum of 10 days for an answer, so the transfer could be properly investigated with a potential positive response. Nonetheless, the fact was that the funds were sent in extreme urgency, because my Step father had to pay medical bills.I called again, and gor through to spoke to another team member that had all the information about the transaction.I asked him if it would be possible to tell me the mistakes on typing the IBan number and all the transfer details. He told me that I should look at the receipt provided after the transfer. I had a look and it doesn't show any of the total details of the transfer. I then told him that I couldn't understand how it happened when I only did copy and paste and checked all the details over and over again since it was the first time your company online.The person told me that he couldn't reveal the wrong digits pressed and told me to wait till they had more information.The next day, I receive an email to inform me that a refund wouldn't be possible, without any other type of information or feedback.It is quite sad that a huge company like yours can treat it's customers in this way.I have spoken to a lawyer that advised me to write to you in good faith, to get some try and get some kind of agreement. If it can't be settled, I will then forward a letter of complaint to the Financial Ombudsmen to get this matter sorted.Please let me know your thoughts,Kindly and respectfully,Wadilson Ferreira Da Cruz Vaz Ferreira"Unfortunately, what you see above is my insatisfaction with how my issue has been treated. I have proof of the transaction. All I am asking is total clarity.Kind regards Wadilson Ferreira

Author: HZQ
Review Title: Seamless Money Transfers Made Easy with MoneyGram App
Review Text: In an era where efficiency and convenience reign supreme, the MoneyGram app emerges as a beacon of simplicity and reliability for sending money. Recently, I had the pleasure of using the MoneyGram app to send funds to a friend abroad, and I must say, the experience was nothing short of exceptional.From the moment I downloaded the app, I was impressed by its user-friendly interface. Navigating through the various options was intuitive, and within minutes, I had set up my account and initiated the transfer process. Unlike traditional methods that often involve lengthy paperwork and waiting in line, the MoneyGram app allowed me to complete the entire transaction from the comfort of my home.One of the standout features of the app is its speed. In a matter of seconds, my friend received a notification that the money was available for pickup at the nearest MoneyGram location. The real-time tracking feature provided me with peace of mind, allowing me to monitor the status of the transfer every step of the way.Furthermore, the security measures implemented by MoneyGram are commendable. With end-to-end encryption and robust identity verification protocols, I felt confident knowing that my financial information was in safe hands.What truly sets the MoneyGram app apart, however, is its global reach. With thousands of locations spanning over 200 countries and territories, sending money to loved ones across the globe has never been easier. Whether it's supporting family members abroad or helping out a friend in need, the MoneyGram app facilitates seamless transactions with unparalleled convenience.In conclusion, my experience using the MoneyGram app was nothing short of stellar. Its user-friendly interface, lightning-fast transfers, top-notch security, and global accessibility make it my go-to choice for sending money. If you're looking for a hassle-free way to transfer funds, look no further than the MoneyGram app.

Generally speaking, if I'm trying to send a money transfer via moneygram, I NEED it to be there in minutes.  Not wait until NEXT MONTH!

Author: John Brown
Review Title: MoneyGram in Germany is slow now
Review Text: MoneyGram in Germany is slow now. They stopped using Sofort for instant online bank transfers and have started using Trustly instead. Trustly grabs the money right away, but takes 1 to 2 business days to send the money to MoneyGram. MoneyGram waits for the money to be received. Instead of 15 minutes, it takes several days to send cash when paying with online bank transfer. MoneyGram doesn't warn about this in advance. It still claims that the cash will be available in 15 minutes. Only after payment is made do they reveal that it will take several days.

Author: Valerie Johnson
Review Title: Moneygram won't refund my cancelled transaction
Review Text: I asked Moneygram to cancel a transaction for me so I could resend it in 3 transaction. This was because the rules of the country (not Moneygram rules) my family member needed 2 photo ID and Bill in her name to collect the amount that I was sending. It was Moneygram customer service who advised me to cancel and    they would  refund me so I could then  resend  it. She cancelled the transaction for me on the 1st of March and I'm still waiting for the refund of my money!! Numerous phone calls and emails later they keep promising it will come through but nothing has happened yet! They take my complaints and rudely demand that I wait for it to be refunded!!! I have never ever experience any thing like this before.  I made the transfer directly from my bank (UK residence) and as helpful as my bank has tried to be they cannot help. The Financial Ombudsman has said they are currently still in the time scale so they can't intervene as yet, so here I am a few thousand pounds out of pocket and Moneygram has their fingers doing something else other than counting me back my money.  Very disturbing as they won't even tell me WHY the won't or can't refund me. They just  claim they are having "issues" . I've got issues with you Moneygram!!!

Author: Saravana Sakkaravel
Review Title: If you want to transfer your money and wait for weeks and weeks to get the refund without knowing any clue then go for Moneygram
Review Text: I have made a transfer to Moneygram from my HSBC account on 23 Feb 2024.  After 4 days Moneygram updated the transfer status as cancelled. No EMail. No Reasons. No Communications.I was reaching out help options in Moneygram first, It stated the transaction is cancelled So, I will receive my money back by 13 Mar 2024. I don't have any clue why the transaction got cancelled and why they are keeping my money for more than 10 days. If it is cancelled, they should return the money immediately. But, I waited for 13 Mar, but there was no refund. I contacted them through email, call, raised service forms etc, but they simply said they haven't received money so, contact your bank. (They have simply closed my complain raised through their service form Case #33964108 without even informing me. The live chat customer service person confirmed that and he has given new case number 34025920. I don't know the status of this case).I contacted my bank HSBC, they have confirmed the money has been processed successfully on the same day. Again, I went back to Moneygram, then they said I need to check with Trustly. I didn't even aware of I am using Trustly in this transfer process. All I did was, initiated a transfer from Moneygram app and transferred money to the details they have provided from My HSBC bank. So, they are the one engaging Trustly in between. But, not taking any responsibility.I haven't got my money back still.Poor communication. Poor Customer Service. Waste of Time. If you want to transfer your money and wait for weeks and weeks to get the refund without knowing any clue then go for Moneygram.

Author: customer
Review Text: They need to be more transparent about their policies on international transfers. Wise is very clear on this- "no business transactions to or from Pakistan" pops up as a clear message when making a transfer to Pakistan. Moneygram has no such notice nor can you find this on googling. It took a week of waiting, emailing and phoning to find this- AND they weren't clear on this from the start!First, the transaction just showed as "in process". No further information or update for 48 hours (not including the weekend). At least Wise gives you a reason for the delay so you know you need to do something about it. I gave it 4 days including the weekend before raising a complaint only to be asked to call them, where I was asked for ridiculously personal details about the recipient as "security questions" to clear the transaction despite stating to them that I am a client and do not have access to this information. They gave me the option to collect it on their behalf and phone them back, so I did. Only to be told the transaction will be cancelled due to policies around transfers to the country. I mean, this all seems like a ploy to collect personal information to me. Why go to all these lengths and play this game of "security questions" when you're just going to decline the transaction?? Why not say that from the start?! I've now lost the services I had wanted to pay for and my money is yet to be refunded to me. Do better, Moneygram! Absolutely disgusting

Review Text: I'm not happy with this company MoneyGram...my family send me transaction for pick up money and when I go to receive the money just say me this reference number is error code I call the customer service on MoneyGram and just say going try again and again that is 3 days and send me the different location too and try again but it's same problem error code I pay for taxi driver 52 quick for that just wasting my time and give me stress....after 3 days de give new reference number and I pick up the money but not good.....soo bad MoneyGram customer service not give me information why happened this just say me try again maybe 20 times I try.....

Author: Ken Imrie
Review Text: I setup a money transfer from my UK bank account to my friend in UAE to be picked up cash. After clearing compliance with Santander bank, the funds were transferred to Moneygram. Moneygram sent me an email stating clearly that the transaction was approved and ready to collect.Twice my friend went to his local agent - showing proof on the second occasion that it was approved by Moneygram. They declined to pay him both times.I called the UK customer services. They transferred me to Moneygram compliance team. I spoke with Valentina who took me through compliance and said the transaction was no longer on hold and could be collected immediately using the original details.My friend went to the agent for the THIRD time and was refused the funds. He was told Moneygram had cancelled the transaction.The money was refunded to my bank account without explanation nor apology.I have now closed my Moneygram account and I am successfully using Western Union instead.My advice: don’t use Moneygram.PS. Read all the Moneygram 1* reviews. They like to reply, but not in person. Every reply is the same automated response. That’s not a caring company!

Author: Simon Adebisi
Review Title: Don’t use MoneyGram they are terrible
Review Text: Don’t use MoneyGram they are terrible, based on my experience the worst ever money transfer service. I sent 5 payments through MoneyGram to Nigeria on 28/03/2024 this payments are supposed to take just 2 days, it is now 05/04/2024 they have only been able to confirm 1 payment just last night 04/04/2024. For a global organization as big as MoneyGram that is shameful and very depressing, how they are still in business providing this type of terrible services is shocking.

Author: MR
Review Title: AVOID this company if you want to keep…
Review Text: AVOID this company if you want to keep your money!MoneyGram gives a good rate for transfer, reasonably easy to use their apps. It's all good until you have a problem!I have transferred money to my father's bank account in Bangladesh, which hasn't been deposited into the account. When I contacted MoneyGram, they said my father would have to go to a local agent with his ID and call a number while he was there! My father is 85 years old, with very little mobility. He can't hear. He lives in a remote village, the nearest MoneyGram agent would be about 150 KM away. I explained to Moneygram that it was just impossible for him to do that. I requested them to refund the money to my card from where I have made the payment. Since then, no response from them!They are happy to keep your money when they can't deposit it into the account you gave. Now I am going to the court to get my money back! Who want this hastle?

Author: Christy Enebeli
Review Text: Where do I begin? I haven't used Moneygram since the only option to send  money was visiting a store. I decided to download their app and send money as on said day, they had the highest rate.Issues:1. They kept rejecting transfers on grounds of being over limit, but didn't actually tell me what the limit is.2. Money transfer isn't instant. I am on day 4. Still nothing.3. Status is stuck at processing, and there's no contact from them whatsoever.  So you think oh they are working on it. Think again!4. They want to "protect" me but kept my money and made no contact with me. They didn't notify me of an issue via email or their app. On contact, live chat is rubbish. It  timed out in the middle of my enquiry 3 times! I gave up, searched for a number and called.5. They asked all these questions then said.. your money will be released... but suprise! It "will take another 3 days! (depending on receiver's bank)". Who takes three days to transfer in this day and age? This said receiver gets instant money from me via other providers previously used.6. Ask to complain and you get this feeling they are trying to prevent you from doing so but not actually acting on your concerns. They just repeat the same line.. "it is for your protection" will "feedback" to the team. On request to complain, passed to the online team who made me start all over providing personal details. This person wasn't actually in the complaints dept. He made me repeat every word on grounds of not hearing me. Bear in mind I am on the phone at 5am trying to get them to send my money. So woke my baby up as I had to repeat myself over and over. In my opinion,  he heard enough personal data to work with, but kept asking for more despite me saying baby is waking and happy to give reference to find acct quicker. I still didn't have my complaint logged.Needless to say other money apps I used where instant and did not stress me. Won't be using Money Gram again. The experience made me feel I may have downloaded a proxy app and now lost my money. I didn't feel it was the real Money Gram. aone can't be too carefull. I had to go on Google to keep checking there aren't reports of a proxy money gram because this has been a nightmare.

Author: Zuliben J Patel
Review Text: Very Disappointed with the service provided by MoneyGram. Unfortunately, my recent experience has been nothing short of frustrating and unsatisfactory.First and foremost, the transaction process was plagued with delay and complications. Despite assurances of swift transactions, my transfer is taking an unreasonably long time to complete. This delay caused inconvenience and unnecessary stress, especially considering the urgency of the transfer.Moreover, the lack of clear communication throughout the process only exacerbated the situation. I was left in the dark regarding the status of my transfer, with no explanations provided for the delays until I contacted MoneyGram. This lack of transparency is unacceptable and reflects poorly on your MoneyGram's commitment to customer service.Furthermore, when I attempted to seek assistance from helpdesk, the staff could not resolve the matter even all relevant information was provided. Representatives were unable to provide satisfactory solutions to my concerns, further adding to my frustration.

Author: Stephanie Bradshaw
Review Title: If I could leave a no star rating
Review Text: If I could leave a no star rating, I completely would!!!! This organization gives false information in regards to the time it takes for money to reach a bank account, and REFUSES to give me my money back, “because it has already been processed”. If that’s the case, why isn’t my money in my account as it should be, if the transaction has been processed? I was told it was the fault of my banking institution, but when I called to check, they hadn’t received ANYTHING!!!! Where is the money that I paid, but no one can refund it? I have reference numbers, times the money was sent, and all of the information that the representative requested. Still nothing!!!! This is not acceptable for any reason. The greed of this organization is unsettling and quite frankly, extremely disgraceful and unacceptable. Money gram is a corporation that should be made to shut its doors because of false information, and refusal to refund money for whatever reason may arise. Sometimes it’s truly a matter of life and death in regards to money being processed or refunded when needed. It’s awful strange how an institution can TAKE or money, not inform you that it can’t be refunded after whatever reason they decide on that day, and still be in operation. They can sure TAKE money that isn’t theirs, but they can’t refund it. Not acceptable!!!! Money Gram just lost a customer, and I will be contacting an attorney after what they have done to me. I will advocate to close their doors from this point forward.

Author: Raymond Heckard
Review Title: Moneygram  a fraud, bad customer service
Review Text: On November 4, 2023 my daughter sent $100 dollars to my wife’s polish debit card, which my wife never received. My daughter contacted my wife to see if she received the funds, my wife went to her bank, and found out that they do not accept direct deposits from moneygram to their debit cards, which are under MasterCard. My daughter contacted moneygram and canceled the transfer, and moneygram refused the money, but later took the money back statin they money was deposited on my wife’s debit card. Moneygram launched a review and states the transfer was completed for the sum of 406.27 PLN, of which my wife’s bank has no record of. MoneyGram has blocked my daughters account and refuses to talk to her when she calls customer service. Tonight I called moneygram 1 800 number and spoke to customer service, I called to find out what they do if a person makes a direct deposit to a MasterCard debit card, they refused to talk to me and I put my wife on the line with them, she speaks English but not very good, so they get an interpreter for her and asked for the transfer reference number , which she gave them, in which the looked up the information and told my wife to have our daughter who is in California and is the sender to call them, that they had investigated and found the money was deposited on my wife’s MasterCard debit card issued by her Polish Bank, and in reviewing my wife’s deposits back to October, she has no deposit of 406.27 PLN or any amount close to it, as all her deposits are under 100 PLN. Any time I was talking to my wife the moneygram agent was very rude and told me he could only talk to the recipient, which I explained I was explaining things to my wife who speaks Ukrainian, Russian, Polish and English. I finally demanded to talk to his supervisor, which he gave us a run around, and kept stating have the sender call, because they have investigated and they money was transferred to my my wife. When we explained that moneygram was refusing to talk to our daughter, he just keep repeating to have her contact them. When she called she refused to talk to her. I finally got to talk to his supervisor once I became irate with him, and when his supervisor talked to my wife it was a echo chamber of have the sender call them, which she can’t because they have blocked her. I told the supervisor we will be contacting the FTC consumer protection. Then she figured out my wife was on speaker phone and refused to talk to my wife untill she took the call off speaker phone, we told her we could not because we was calling on Skype, so she ended the call. I will never do business with moneygram ever again,

Author: Manuel S.
Review Title: Account suspended without explanation after using it for 2 years.
Review Text: I've had an account since 2021 and I used between 5 and 10 times to send money from Canada to a one single contact in Italy without any issue.After so long this week before trying to transfer I had to update the existing recipient as the bank had changed and so the account or IBAN and SWIFT numbers.After this update and filled out all the requested info in the form, I received a message that because a security issue that could be harmful for me, the transfer was not going to be done and my account was suspended with no further information.I reached out the contact support which no information repeated what was just happened, thus I had to go to a physical location to do the transfer.Since this me to happened, I looked up for a different service that allowed me to transfer the money to the same destination without any problem.This is unacceptable from any customer service. No solution, no information why I lost my account and I will not be able to user the service.This is my experience with this service and with no doubts I want everyone be aware of these type of issues.Note: an excerpt of their email "We regret to inform you that MoneyGram is unable to process your transaction at this time. Additionally, your account has been suspended".

Review Text: I have been using moneygram for over 5 years now, I often send money several times a day to my fiance in Kenya to her mobile wallet account. She usually receives within minutes of me sending her from Australia, the exchange rates are always excellent compared to other companies and the $1.99 transfer fee is very low and fixed no matter what amount I send. The only issue I have is occasionally the transfer for some reason unbeknown is it can be delayed for up to 8 hours before she receives and trying to find out why is a hopeless assignment, the customer service number is no help at all, all you get is a automated message saying that the transfer is on its way and they should receive within 1-4 business days, which is unacceptable for me as the reason I use moneygram is because of them saying if you send to a mobile money account it's usually recieved within minutes. This is the only reason I haven't rated them 5 stars.

Review Title: What made my experience great is that it's fast and easy to use.
Review Text: What made my experience great is that it's easy to create an account and easy to send money wherever and it's fast, it only takes seconds for the receiver to pick up the money, the only thing what sucks is that sometimes the confirmation number sometimes won't go through and the person who is receiving won't be able to pick up the money and you'll have to cancel and resend it again but you won't get your refunds back within 10 business day. But the good news is that you will get your money back the amount you send but not the fee that it charged you to send that will take some time to get back so if you resend money you will have to pay a fee again, but other than that this app is great and easy to use I recommend this app for everyone who wants to send money to their loved ones either out here or to the ones locked up.

Author: Jennifer
Review Title: Your fees are super high for a domestic…
Review Text: Your fees are super high for a domestic transfer. I broke my debit card and before ordering a new one I needed to withdraw some money to pay my rent/bills. Your advertisements said you have very low fees. (Less then $5 to transfer funds locally and internationaly.) Also I loved that I was able to transfer money from my debit card to myself online, and pick up my cash locally within minutes. However it cost me such a large amount in your fees! Hundreds of dollars! I am on SSDI so every penny matters a lot to me/my family. I was in a bind and I had no other options or choice but to go through with the transaction. It should be noted that I absolutely loved everything about my experience other than the hugh fees I had to pay. Thank you for being the only company to help someone in my position.

Review Title: MoneyGram is such an easy way to help…
Review Text: MoneyGram is such an easy way to help my loved ones.  It is available in minutes and they really need the assistance.  Thank you.  Looking back at the transaction, I remember a problem MoneyGram helped me with.  I made a transfer of the amount the local branch told the limit to the receiver.  When he went to retrieve it, he was told it had to be made in two payments  on different days.  Your representative help me with cancelling the first transfer.  The two transfers were made completely, but delayed his trip.  I realize you have minimal control for these branches in other countries, but their stupid and hidden rules are very frustrating.

Author: Crostina
Review Text: Never again.  In September 2023 I sent £157, 00 to a personal account in Ecobank to Gambia. The bank and the receiver haven't ever got the money. The bank personnel has clearly stated that their bank isn't integrated to receive monies from Moneygram. There will be no document to show as 'evidence'- because the platform does not exist at the moment. I spoke to an employee of the bank, through long WhatsApp calls and tests A lot of complaints to Moneygram, which always didn't produce any statements and documents of their allegations. Also, Moneygram told me to open a case with aFinancial Ombudsman Service in London. Again no documents were shown to me but the outcome was that the investigator won’t be upholding this complaint. Shame! Shame! Scams always perpetuated against small savers!!!!

Author: customer Oriel
Review Title: Wasted a whole morning on this
Review Text: Wasted a whole morning on this, simply trying to send a (really) small seasonal gift to a friend in India.  I had a MoneyGram card, but thought I'd try online.  Result: account frozen as soon as I tried to make the transaction, with no reason given. I cut up my MoneyGram card and rang customer service to request my personal details are deleted, and received an uninformative and high-handed email to say that it isn't possible to delete all my personal details.  The only possible justification for this under GDPR is the suspicion of a crime - I am outraged by this; the amount I tried to sent is paltry and could not possibly be part of any money laundering enterprise. I just want confirmation of the deletion of my personal details. If this doesn't happen my next step is the UK ICO, because they should have to justify retention of these details. No idea what's going on, but beware this company!

Author: Cristina Elena Nitu
Review Text: I downloaded the application, created an account, entered my bank details.  I read information about the transfer process.  the information is vague, the information is not complete. I needed the money to be able to have it online because I am unable to physically go to a store to withdraw the money.  My mother went to a store to send me money.  I spoke with her on the phone so that I could provide her with any information she needed to fill out the form.  the people at the store said they only needed my full name and phone number, so I hung up.  then my mother sent me the reference number.  that's how I found out that the application is only useful for tracking that the money has been transferred...where?  anywhere but not in the account.  I have to go physically to fill out another form with the identity document.  he also paid the service, of course.  a useless service that created major problems for me instead of helping me quickly as it should have.  I contacted the customer service, but they told me that they can't do anything, that I can only withdraw them if I go to a store.  if I wanted to receive the money online in the bank account, those from moneygram had to add the recipient's account number.  which did not happen because they said there was no need.  us not knowing this fact.  I do not recommend!  you are wasting your time.  plus the customer relations staff are employed for nothing.  the fee for their service is high and the service, instead of helping, creates problems for you.

Author: Muhammad Tabish Gondal Khanam
Review Title: I had a truly terrible experience with…
Review Text: I had a truly terrible experience with MoneyGram for a recent money transfer. On December 14th, 2023, I sent a significant amount of money through their service, fully expecting it to reach the intended recipient in a timely manner. However, to my utter disappointment and frustration, the money never reached its destination.After realizing that the money had not been received, I immediately tried to contact MoneyGram for assistance. Unfortunately, my attempts to reach out to them were met with complete silence. They ignored my emails, leaving me feeling helpless and abandoned.Finally, after two weeks of persistence, MoneyGram responded to my inquiries, but their explanation for the failed transaction was vague and unsatisfactory. They simply stated that my transcript had been canceled without any clear justification. This lack of transparency only added to my frustration and confusion.To add insult to injury, MoneyGram assured me that they would refund my money promptly. However, it has now been more than one week since they made that promise, and I am still waiting for the refund to materialize. Their failure to fulfill this commitment has left me feeling deceived and deeply disappointed in their services.Overall, my experience with MoneyGram has been nothing short of a nightmare. From the initial failed transaction to the lack of communication and delayed refund, I have faced nothing but inconvenience and frustration. I would strongly advise against using MoneyGram for any money transfer needs, as their poor service and lack of reliability have caused me significant distress and financial loss.

Review Text: Transfers are generally easy to submit and quick to deliver. Of the many transfers I've made, only a few have been delayed. As I write, I'm still waiting for a transfer to be delivered three days later. The recipient needed the funds, so I had to send a second transfer, meanwhile the first can not be cancelled as it's to a mobile wallet. So this delay has cost me twice as much!  I do appreciate that MoneyGram warns against potential scams, without being overly intrusive into my personal affairs.

Author: Angry customer
Review Text: Worst experience ever, I would not recommend using MoneyGram at all to transfer money. I’ve been awaiting nearly 2 weeks now to receive money through that platform and still not being able to receive my money. I have been trying to add my reference number and last name on the website to get my ID verified and it’s not recognising it. I’ve been in contact we’ve at least seven agents over the past two weeks, and none of them have been able to sort my issue out. One of them told me that I needed to get a refund because it’s a technical issue from their side. However, since I told the sender to ask for a refund he’s been told that he can’t get a refund and the only way to get it Is only if I get my account blocked then I had someone else on the phone who told me this is not the case I could get a refund. They basically Not communicating and telling us different things. after descender contacted them again for refound once he got angry. They agreed to give him a refund but he had to wait to business working days. Now that two working days have passed. He’s been told that they are still not able to give him the money back because they having issues on their site. Now I’m wondering why is it so difficult to give us the money back why?

Author: Gerald
Review Title: MoneyGram transfers went well this year
Review Text: We send monetary holiday season presents to family and friends in eastern Europe each year. Since most do not have bank accounts, we use the 'Money Pick' up option rather than transfer money to bank account option.  These transfers were easily done this year. In some previous years, the ease of 'on-line' transfer was problematic, i.e. sometimes I could easily sign-in, other times MoneyGram would not let me sign in.  When I couldn't sign in, I contacted customer 'no-service' to resolve the issues. None of these contacts went well,   It is my hope (and prayer) that next and subsequent years, that I continue to have positive experiences.

Author: Susan
Review Title: Paying overseas contractors in Nigeria is easy!
Review Text: I am a book publisher, and I've been using MoneyGram lately to pay my overseas contractors for illustration work. Before using MoneyGram, it was difficult to find a payment fund transfer company that worked in Nigeria, and that also didn't give me a hard time about sending money to someone in Nigeria. They claimed they were trying to "protect" me from scams by not letting my payments go through. It was extremely irritating because all it did was complicate the process to the point where I couldn't use their services anymore. In contrast, MoneyGram has been easy to use and easy to contact when I have questions. Payments to my Nigerian artists are going through without a hitch, which I appreciate tremendously because my valuable time is not wasted.

Author: Andrew
Review Text: It will be helpful to sync up MoneyGram's policies and pick up locations policies. It is so frustrating paying a fee for a transaction and your pick up locations refuses to disburse the money because they want the initial transaction canceled and broken into two separate transactions. By doing so, the customer loses the initial fee paid (when the customer did absolutely nothing wrong). If a transaction is canceled because one of your pick up location's requested it, then the customer should not be held responsible and the fees should be refunded.It is a scam that needs to be STOPPED.

Review Text: I sent 430 dollars to my father's mobile wallet, and he never received the money in his wallet. I reside in the United States and my father is in Ghana. Please do not use these services; they are pathetic and unreliable. Stay away from these scammers. Author: Jose I
Review Text: Easy to send money online. Website is simple and responsive

Author: Richard
Review Text: I was trying to send some money to a long-time friend of my wife. This friend is Ukrainian, displaced by the war to Austria. The money was not available to the woman when she traveled an hour to retrieve it until she talked to a MoneyGram representative by calling a toll-free number in Austria. The problem is she didn't speak German. We were given a toll-free number for her to call in Ukraine but it was going to require another lengthy bus trip and delay.I cancelled the transfer and used a different service with no problem. I tried to get my money back but had to talk with customer service who started asking me questions like how long my wife had known the woman, had I ever met the woman (yes, I had), when was the last time I met the woman, and, my favorite, what was the woman going to do with the money! It was a little over a hundred dollars. She was going to use it to buy necessities but it really wasn't any of MoneyGram's business, much less mine, just what she was going to do with the money. I felt like I was having to argue with the company to get my money back AFTER I had cancelled the transfer. I have always appreciated the convenience of MoneyGram and it has usually been hassle free but this was not a good experience.

Author: sohel
Review Title: Moneygram took my money twice but paid once
Review Text: i sent £100 on 27th Nov but Moneygram took Money from my bank twice and deposited it once which means that they paid £100 equivalent money to the receiver's bank account overseas. when I contacted them on 1st December, Moneygram told me that they just took £100 once even though Moneygram Apps & my Barclays Bank also showed that MoneyGram took £100 twice. After 3 e-mails, they e-mailed me back today i.e. 7th December that they are still working on it.So be careful of using Moneygarm.

Author: Dwain Mundle
Review Text: Transaction Reference No. 92524271After using this system regularly, while visiting Jamaica I transferred £1200 to a builder who did some work on my house. To cut a long argument short, the builder was refused the money because a young man working at the till informed him that he had exceeded his limit and that the sender should have noticed. I visited this agency with the builder and I asked what could I do because I sent the money. I was told that I should have noticed that the builder exceeded his limit and I must cancel the transaction. This agency in May Pen Clarendon is renowned for diverting from the policies giving customers the runaround. Furthermore, we were given a form and told to provide 2 proofs of ID, a letter from JP, utility bills....etc. Sadly, it stated on MoneyGram website clearly states that the form is to be used when the transaction ID is unknown. Why MoneyGram is recruiting these illiterate junk who continue to make up their own rules? I will not stop commenting until Money Gram addresses this issue because a lot of law-abiding citizens are affected by these outlaws! Following these illiterate fools I cancelled my transaction and I hope I do not have to use this scam system.

Overall, a dependable choice for sending money abroad, but with a little more attention to customer support, it could be excellent!

Author: Shaharior Rahman
Review Title: Loss due to third party bank tranaction
Review Text: I sent big amounts of money through moneygram regularly. However, there is a recent policy from Bangladeshi banks which introduced an extra 2.5% incentive (in addition to the already existing 2.5% incentive from the government) for remittances. However, I did not get the bank incentive as the bank says the money needs to be sent directly to my bank, not another bank in Bangladesh. This caused me a big loss. I did not know moneygram uses third party and customers are deceived this way. When I called moneygram about an inquiry on this issue, the handling staff was not helpful enough and continuously interrupted during my explanation. I felt deceived and frustrated. So sad that moneygram is losing it's reputation this way.

Author: Patrick Slade
Review Title: Having been a loyal client for 15 years I will never use them again
Review Text: Up until yesterday I have to admit that I have had no substantive problems with Moneygram.  It then looks like they have suffered from government interference in that they have become far more intrusive in the questions they ask. As irritating as it is, I do not altogether blame Moneygram for the fact that I have to tell them stuff like the source of the money and what the end user wants to spend it on.          However things can change very quickly.  I arranged for a transfer of money to my wife in the Philippines and Moneygram confirmed that the cash was ready to pick up.  I sent a copy of the noyification to my wife who then went to the agent in the Philippines which is about an hour away.  When she was there she was told that the transaction had been cancelled.  It was not cancelled by me so I called moneygram only to be told that when she went to pick it up their system had cancelled it.  I checked my bank and the money that I had paid was sitting on my account as a pending payment so there was no problem there.  The man I spoke with them said something about the receiver had gone over the limit.  This was only the second amount she received (or not as in this case) and both had been small amounts.  I pointed out that moneygram had received no additional information since I originally sent the money over and so if there was a problem they could have picked it up then and not waited until my wife had travelled to the Philippine agent to pick up the money.  I pointed out that Moneygram had stated that the cash was ready for collection which was obviously not true.  They lied to me.   I pointed out that they had my money but he said it would be refunded within 10 working days so they would keep my money for two weeks.  Given that this whole fiasco was their fault and not my wife's fault I asked how Moneygram were going to compensate my wife for all the inconvenience and trouble they had caused.  The response to that question was not forthcoming in any way at all.  The man I was speaking to spent the entire conversation avoiding answering questions I was asking, becoming increasingly evasive and rude.  In the end, though, I have to give him credit for being very helpful.  He put the phone down on me, thus confirming that there is no circumstance that would persuade me ever to use their services again

Author: None
Review Title: Account has been closed indefinitely, without notice.
Review Text: I have been using the moneygram service for just over a year, during which time i’ve sent a number of transactions to family in Jamaica which we usually do to support family. Each time I noticed that they would hold the transaction and it would only be when I would find out that the recipient was unable to collect the funds and I would ring moneygram only to be told that extra information was needed because i’m sending to a high risk country and this could be the case for sending even £40 for larger amount I would literally have to tell them my whole life history. Then suddenly they cancelled my transaction without an explanation, which I immediately resend only to later find out that I could no longer sign into my online account, so I contacted their customer service team only to be told that my account had been closed indfinately for security reasons, I mean it's not like was sending thousands of a pound each time, so for them to just close my account that I use to send a little money to help out my family is shameful and them they say it's an high-risk country when I can proof that the money is going to my family members with the same surname, what do they expect my family to do now. Bet they are not closing down the scammer's accounts. I work hard for my money and I want the best for my family; I don't want them to have to resort to criminal activities which is why I assist them.

Author: Nazim Ragimov
Review Text: I made a transfer from Canada to Armenia, and the recipient was able to pick up the money. However, the bank immediately froze the transaction, stating it breached their internal policy without specifying the issue. I contacted MoneyGram support for details, but they declined to investigate. They advised that the transfer could be collected at another bank, implying it wasn't their problem. It's disappointing that MoneyGram doesn't address issues with their agent banks, resulting in a frustrating experience and wasted time.

Review Text: This company claims above all to be simpke and easy. After spending HOURS in multiple institutions that work with MoneyGram I was still unable to secure my transfer. Review Text: Started a transfer to pay for a special offer, that was only valid for 2 days. Clicked on "payment immediately from the account" (like I did before, but this time it was noted "payment immediate through Trustly". The money has been taken off immediately from my account, and all of a sudden I did not receive a reference number like before, but an authorization number and it said" "We are processing the transfer which could take 3 to 5 working days. I tried to cancel immediately, and they stated, it could take 2 weeks to get the money refunded. This is a Scam - I never expected this from a reputable company like MoneyGram. How can they do this? It is a way how thieves behave, and I will review, if I will continue with MoneyGram. The special price will be gone in one day, and I will have to pay 20% more. - I am shocked - this is like cheating on your customers

Author: YK
Review Text: I completely stopped using this service for all outgoing transactions about six months ago. My experience with them left me incredibly frustrated. I needed some basic refund information like a specific date, time, and written confirmation, but the customer support team just couldn't seem to provide these critical details. I even asked for an official email to use as proof with my bank for a refund, but they simply didn't offer any help.If you're looking for efficient service and quick support, I strongly recommend checking out other legitimate apps and services. I found one alternative that took just two minutes to give me all the documentation I needed to file a debit card dispute and get my refund processed smoothly. In comparison, this service falls far short of expectations.I wouldn't recommend this service to anyone. Instead, go with an alternative that provides more efficient and responsive support. And please, don't suggest that I reach out to a feedback email; I've already tried reaching out extensively without any resolution.

Author: Denise
Review Title: I will not use this company in life frightening situation.
Review Text: A family member was critically ill in hospital in Africa and needed operation, so I urgently sent money to help with hospital bills which my family were waiting for. I used MoneyGram to send money which went through ok as they took money from my bank account, but to my surprised MoneyGram did not give the money to the recipient which was badly needed for operation. MoneyGram did not only bother to tell me why they did not sent the money but they also kept my money for nearly a week and I could not send the replacement until I get the money back from MoneyGram and because of this the operation did not go ahead and the patient died. MoneyGram customer service centre were extremely uncaring and unhelpful.  They spoke to me as though they were doing me a favour. Also I used to use MoneyGram thinking it was par of the Post Office, so to support my Post Office but actually they are not I found out. The actual date this happen is sometime around 2022 as review system does not let me get back further.

Review Text: The receiver of the sum I transferred to in Iraq was given the sum in (Iraqi dinars) currency despite of my chosen option of (US dollars) currency on MoneyGram's website. My transfer receipt clearly stated the receiver should be able to collect the sum in (US dollars), at the collection point (in city of Erbil in Iraq) the receiver was given the sum in (Iraqi dinar) and the receiver was asked to sign the collection document which stated that (MoneyGram) handed over the transfer sum in (US dollars)! This is simply an indirect robbing of an extra percentage by the collection point and by MoneyGram.

Review Text: MoneyGramThis company never respect their clients and act like MoneyBordel.Looking to have your account CLOSED without any explanations MONEYHELL is here to drive you crazy.MoneyGram closed my online account for no apparent reason. While insisting that I proceed with future transactions in store. The last transaction I know I made was in store. Which means that my online account got closed due to me making an in-store transaction. While they insist, I make any future transaction in store. Unable to provide details for closing my account other than security reason, no details on what raise the red flag when I sent money to my wife in store using MoneyGram. I'll stop using MoneyGram and I'll recommend Western Union, Wise, PayPal... but never MoneyHell...

Author: Rohullah Khan
Review Text: Extremely Frustrating Experience with MoneyGramI recently had an incredibly frustrating experience with MoneyGram that I feel compelled to share. The incompetence and unprofessionalism displayed by their employees left me baffled and angered.Firstly, it's clear that MoneyGram's own employees lack a fundamental understanding of their own system. When faced with a problem, they seem incapable of providing a simple solution and instead resort to robotic, scripted responses. It's infuriating to deal with individuals who can't think outside the box and offer genuine assistance.Moreover, the disrespect and rudeness I encountered during my interactions with MoneyGram employees were absolutely unacceptable. One particular individual, who identified himself as Adam, exhibited a complete lack of professionalism in both his tone and demeanor. It's disheartening to witness such behavior from representatives of a supposedly reputable company.The primary issue that led to my dissatisfaction was the arbitrary blocking of my MoneyGram account, without any explanation or valid reason provided. Despite my repeated attempts to resolve the matter, the only response I received was that the system would magically "reboot" after a week. However, almost two weeks have passed, and I find myself stuck in a frustrating loop, with MoneyGram continuously pushing the timeline for a resolution.This level of incompetence, unprofessionalism, and disregard for customer concerns is simply unacceptable. It's clear that their customer service and problem-solving capabilities leave much to be desired.

But if I go to stores that serve Moneygram and have the same problem, they have the option to change the receiver’s name  without resending it ( still the same informations) and the service fee is not deducted when they do the refund. Why you don’t have that option online to change the receiver’s or sender’s name without resending it  and the service fee should not be deducted  on the refund. Thank  you.

Author: Amy
Review Text: I have used MoneyGram many times and the past experience on 9.11.23 was not so good.  The cashier at CVS had me process my transaction twice because she said I had to provide my passport.  I told her I send money all the time to my family in the Caribbean (almost every week) and I have never been asked to show my passport.  I ended up leaving the store and going to another one.  There they told me that she needed to choose drivers license as a form of verification, so now I know how direct someone if it happens again.  Not the end of the world, just a teaching moment, but I was having a very busy day and that ended up cutting into an hour of work time.I don’t like the way the app works for cash transfers.  When I use my debit card, I can do it from home which is very convenient, fast and efficient.  I can send the reference info to the receiver and even send a card along.  I am also notified when they pick up the cash in the Caribbean.  The system works great!  I have confidence in it and in your service in general.For the past few weeks, I have been awaiting a new debit card to be mailed to me and therefore have had to resort to using the cash method.  These are the things I don’t like about the app when using cash:1) The transaction status never changes from “ready to pay” to “ready to pick-up” and finally “picked-up”.  It just remains “ready to pay”.  This makes me feel uncomfortable because it looks unfinished and is not good for historical record keeping. 2) There is no way to signal the recipient that the funds are ready to pick up other than go into my email and take a screen shot of the reference number and text it to him.3) I am not notified that the cash has been picked up through email and it doesn’t show on the app.  When using the debit card method I am notified in real time so I know when he has picked it up immediately.4) When the cash transactions sit on the transaction history with the status of “ready to pay” there is no distinction from the ones that weren’t paid for and sent and the one that was.  5). I was told at CVS that the “unsent/unpaid” transactions would just drop off, but I don’t trust that and would rather have an option to delete them.As far as non-cash transactions go, I find the app and your service a fantastic way to transfer funds to loved ones overseas.  My only issues are with the cash process as it relates to the app and the experience at the cash locations that complete the transaction.  Thank you for listening.  I hope this feedback will help you improve the customer experience and your services.

Author: Angie
Review Text: Thank you, MoneyGram! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️I have been using MoneyGram for over a year. My experience has been excellent. I normally use it to send money from USA to Colombia every month. I will tell you a little bit more about my experience. - When I opened my account it took a while, understandable, confirm personal data, ID, etc. You've to wait, but it's worth it.- My first transfer also took time, they needed to confirm the sender and receiver's information. Okay.Thereafter, I must say 98% of my transactions arrive the same day, and the few times it has been delayed were because of the receiving bank.- I have contacted customer services twice and have been efficient. They reply very quickly, provide you with information and, if a transaction is declined by the receiver, they refund your money (+fee) in a very short time. They have good exchange rates, some days are better than others and have reasonable fees.

There a lying, scamming company that uses peoples money and blames everyone else for the problem. Can send to anyone in the would in minutes but takes 10 days to send the money there holding of yours back to you. I wont be evey using them again and i will be telling anyone who will listen to do the same.

Author: Pravin
Review Title: The rates given are not market rates.
Review Text: The rates given are not market rates.The current market rate is $1=INR 83.20, while the rate given at moneygram at present is $1=INR 82.2 plus an additional $1.99 fee for instant and $0.99 standard payment speed for online banking. The amount of hidden charges here are astounding. I understand there is a business to run and money to earn. But at least moneygram can be upfront about it.

Author: Wesley
Review Text: Dear MoneyGram! I will never use your services again. I have been a loyal customer for years, choosing you over your partners and yesterday as I tried to receive money from my MOTHER I was told I reached a limit and no one could give me the proper information as to what occurred. I have been sending and receiving money for years between my mother and I and when I really needed it most you were not there to help. Your customer service reps were rude and did nothing to explain what caused the issue so I could fix it. As a loyal customer I was disgusted by the service I received and embarrassed by how your company treated my mother and for that do not expect me or my entire family to use your service any longer.

Review Title: ATROCIOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE REGARDING ID ADVICE...
Review Text: Have been with Moneygram for a long time. As regards transfers etc --great, no problem.Suddenly, without warning, they asked me for ID, which I would have sent, except that I do NOT have a driving license, a passport or any of the other ID they asked for.I tried TWO times to get help on the live chat with a human (supposedly), but each time they said that it needs to be one of these:"PassportUK photo driving licenseUK photo provisional driving licenseArmed Forces Card.If you are not a Non-UK Citizens/ Residents, you can use a:PassportEuropean Community driving licenseBiometric Resident PermitEU ID CardSeafarer IDUK Home Office Application Registration Card (ARC) issued to asylum seekers"I am in ENGLAND, the UK is NOT in the EU, I am NOT in the forces, I am a PENSIONER.I continued to ask them HOW I can get a National ID that would be acceptable---they just sent same thing, with no advice and no guidance.I send small amounts abroad regularly.They treat you like some kind of leper.Of course, all these types of companies are the same.if anyone can advise me on what KIND of UK ID I can get, WHERE to apply and IF it would be ACCEPTABLE to Moneygram, I would be grateful.****UPDATEDI see that you replied to my review, but amazingly failed to offer ANY advice on what to do.Do you see how this makes you look?.

Author: Lucero del Alba
Review Text: MoneyGram's must be among the worst currency exchanges out there, and boy they love forcibly pushing you into it for no particular reason.My mom wanted me to send 2,000 USD from Brazil to Thailand, she handled over the $2k, which were compulsively converted into Brazilian reais (BRL) for no reason—and at an entirely made-up rate—, then back to USD so that they could be converted Thai baht; and on top of that the 387 BRL transaction fee (~80 USD).So, all things considered, my mom spent $2,080 so that a person on the other could receive... $1,750...  a $330 cut... really???MoneyGram is modern version of a medieval usurer.

Author: James
Review Title: Money Arrived Sooner Than With Zelle
Review Text: My bank uses the Zelle system for inexpensive money transfers, and lately I've been sending my family some extra dollars to help in the expense of caring for our elderly mother. I tested both Zelle and MG and MG delivered the money next day. Zelle took 5 days going to my brother and Sister-in-law's bank account, from my bank in Idaho to their bank in Nebraska. A simple bank to bank transfer. Even as a free service, Zelle took far too long to get the money there. Money Gram has a nominal fee, but the next day service was worth it for me.

If I need to send any more than that (Even just like 30-$50)  it's almost guaranteed there will be a problem with pickup due to them having no cash on hand. Other than this issue, I have had no other problems with Moneygrams service.

Author: Karen M
Review Text: Was stopped from sending £201.27/JMD$39,000 a few times last night then tried again several times this morning.  I had to go to a post office which charge you more to send it via them through Moneygram and it still would not go through, the cashier told me it was reading that "I had exceeded my limitation" which is incorrect and not true as they inform me you can send up to £6,000 in one transaction yet I'm only sending small amounts of £60 sometimes.  Several months back I sent £600 through with no trouble.  I rang Moneygram International who now tell me the same thing and said it wasn't them, but some UK regulation or rule that was stopping me which I find hard to believe as something on "their" system is blocking me and said I have to try in one(1) weeks time which is too late, annoying and very disappointing because my relative was relying on that money and needed it yesterday.  I don't know if I will be using Moneygram again going forward as this is an UNRELIABLE SERVICE and I may try Western Union instead or directly if they can open a bank account as I thought Moneygram was more straightforward and less hassle.

Author: Zee H
Review Title: Be Careful If Using Cash Pick Up
Review Text: This review is based on my last experience using MoneyGram. My wife and children are abroad and I made a cash pick transaction. When my wife went to a MoneyGram location, the person in the shop was turning people away citing a technical issue. My wife was the last person in the queue. After those in front were turned away he said to her that there was no problem and he just wanted to serve her and then proceeded to ask her if he could have her number and meet up some time! She was shocked and taken back at what was happening. She composed herself and told him that what he’s doing is totally unacceptable and unprofessional. He then threatened to not give her the money to which she replied that she will call the Police and take it from there. He backed down and promptly got her money and claimed he was only joking.And let’s not forget about the people he turned away.. may be that money was needed urgently for an operation or other serious circumstances.She called me and was very upset. I complained to MoneyGram and it’s been nearly two weeks and have had no call back apart from an email saying they’re “investigating”Zero tolerance is what MoneyGram should have to such practices. Disappointed is an understatement.The next transaction I did was using another provider.

It is protected by a code that in addition to proof of identity has to be presented to the cashier.

Review Text: Banks too slowIn Yerevan, i went to two banks and spent hours with stress to finally get this money. Ararat bank didn't give the money and said no specific reason. I recommend you collect all these information beforehand when i am sending not when i am receiving. because while receiving something may go wrong and i am left with no money overseas.Next time for sure I will take the money with me and won't send by moneygram. It is so simple to go to ATM, get the money, then change it in an exchange rather than using moneygram.Although sender and receiver was myself, still it was such a complex process for receiving bank.

Author: Dennis Ward
Review Text: Payment went through quickly and I informed the recipient of the transaction number. I later received communication from the recipient that they were unable to collect as the agent told them there was an issue but not what it was. I then called Moneygram and enquired why the money could not be paid and was told that the issue was the area I had sent to money to, south of France, as it was renowned for fraudulent transactions. I then answered a series of questions to verify the transaction after which the payment was cleared and the recipient was able to collect the following day. I do appreciate that it is sometimes necessary to verify payments with follow up calls but on this occasion I did not receive any communication from Moneygram informing me that it was necessary and only found out from the recipient.

Author: Hattie
Review Title: Funds still not received after 4 weeks!
Review Text: I made a transfer to an account already saved on my moneygram account at the end of June. Its now the last week in July and the funds have still not reached the recipient's account (also me). I've done many transfers to the exact same saved recipient account details, and the funds usually get to the recipient ac within minutes. The only thing I did differently this time was add a code 'WINBIGUK' which was a promotion moneygram gram informed me it was running for it's customers to be in with a chance of winning a luxury weekend break for two or something to that effect. This could well be the reason for this issue. I've been in touch on several occasions to get the issue resolved but I feel like moneygram is going at this at a rather slow pace. I'm just glad it wasn't funds I was sending for some kind of medical emergency. That would've have been so disastrous.

Author: Steve Crocker
Review Text: Moneygram is quick and simple. I was a loyal Western Union user but they have a problem with security - never recognising my email address,going onto settings to change everything,then having to change my email and opening a new account- meanwhile,a Malian family in western Africa suffering through having to wait. Then they always wanted to check with my bank.So I left them only to use other competitors...but the family in Mali would always have to travel to their capitol city to find a bank that would accept- utter nightmare. Then having to find the fare for a taxi. Or worse,they wouldn't have any saifa ( Mali's currency ) in their bank! This went on and took much of my time.        Then I found your company and making the transaction in the space of 2 minutes ! I share my receipt with an emoji to brighten their day and its immediate. Thank you so much for a much needed money transaction to a poor country . God bless you.

Everytime I send again to my sister's bank account, I will have to find the account number again and fill it in everytime. It can be inconvenient at times especially if you'd like to send money urgently, given the number of digits of bank account you need to double check to make sure it's right. If it's saved, it could be much quicker and less worry.

Author: Richard
Review Title: When it works, it works very well
Review Text: I've had mixed experiences. We're building a house on St Vincent and sometimes need to send money to pay bills. The banking system us terrible and western union limits how much you can send.  Moneygram worked great the first couple of times,  even for a large sum ($4000). Since then experience was mixed.  One large payment i sent to myself was refused by the place I went to pick up, claiming they didn't have the money. I tried again later and got the same answer.  Its the biggest supermarket on the island so that isn't credible.  More recently two transfers to the same person were rejected by MG without explanation.  It takes more than a week for the refunds to reach my account.On the plus side, other transfers have worked very well.  Shame its so unpredictable

During my conversation with others with this issue, it appears that i am not the only person experience the same. Hope Moneygram will take this into account and bring the trust back to their customer.

Author: Elliot Segwere
Review Text: Moneygram has scammed me.I did an online ewallet transaction on the 16/06/2023 (95457864) and another on the 30/06/2023 (81648151) to recipients in Botswana, and the the money could not be recieved as the receivers had no Mascom ewallets accounts. I contacted moneygram uk and explained the transaction couldn't be completed in Botswana, and requested an investigation and refund. To this day - 20/07/2023 I have not received my refunds but rather got an email stating that unfortunately I can't be refunded. No explanation given, and the recipients still haven't collected the money. According to the banking regulations and FSA I'm entitled to a full refund as the transaction hasn't been cashed. Moneygram uk, please refund me all the 2 transactions without any more delays.

When I questioned/complained about it, I received a canned answer about how it was the best value for the customer.  I didn't agree with that answer then and I still don't like it today.  I have a need to use MoneyGram until December, unless I can find a better value for my money.

Review Title: MoneyGram is the best company that ever existed we love you guys don't ever change don't ever raise your prices not too much anyway and give me more coupons in the future LOL
Review Text: Are you kidding I love you guys you are the best company on Earth me and my family send money overseas all the time two bedroom Lebanon and things are terrible over there the inflation is like a thousand percent people don't have enough money to eat so we constantly send money to my relatives just to keep them alive we really appreciate your companies your company I mean don't ever raise your prices please especially on the little guy because you know basically instead of having one family we have three families now you know we just need to help out poor relatives and Lebanon don't ever leave the country I've Loved on these people would die without you we really appreciate you and love you and keep up the good work your prices are so fair it really helps a lot makes life a lot easier you guys are so professional and no problems whatsoever year to year thank you so much for being who you are the only thing I was saying is give me more discounts in the future LOL thank you have a great summer if you have any questions you can call my cell at 734-846-9774 I've been in sales all my life I would love to work for you actually LOL
